LIX

CICERO To CURTIUS PEDUCAEANUS,“ PRAETOR Laodicea, February, 50 B.C.

I am exceptionally fond of M. Fadius⁶; I have constant intercourse with him, and our intimacy is of very long standing. In his various suits I make no request as to your decisions (you will, as your credit and position demand, observe your edict⁰ and your established rule of administration) but this I do ask you—-to let him have as easy access to you as is possible, to grant him without reluctance such requests as are right and proper, and to make him feel that my friendship, even though I am far away, is of service to him, especially with you. That is what I beg of you again and again to do.

LX

CICERO TO C. MUNATIUS Date uncertain.
